snippet: The company said in a preliminary filing its net loss for the second quarter ended June 30 was $15 million, or 9 cents a share.
abstract: American Apparel posts bigger-than-expected quarterly loss as sales stagnated during corporate shake-up that started with suspension of founder Dov Charney as chief executive; company says in preliminary filing its net loss for second quarter ended June 30 was $15 million, or 9 cents a share.
lead_paragraph: The company said in a preliminary filing its net loss for the second quarter ended June 30 was $15 million, or 9 cents a share.
